text:
Cables: Auctoritas Fulroad London
84 Drayton Gardens
London, SW.10
Telephone: Fremantle 6642 (2 lines)
-
The Society of Authors
James A. Fellows, Esq.,
Assistant Director,
National Association of Educational Broadcasters,
1346 Connecticut Avenue,
Washington 36, D.C. 10th April 1964.
Dear Mr. Fellows,
Your letter of March 26th addressed to A.P. Watt and Son has
been passed on to us since the Society handles the radio and television
rights in the works of W.B. Yeats.
We can grant permission in principle for the use of the poems in
the manner you contemplate subject to payment of an appropriate fee.
We shall be glad, therefore, to know what fee you normally offer to
other copyright owners.
Yours sincerely,
n. n-■'<—
amk.jh.
Miss Anne Munro-Kerr,
Head of Radio and Television Department.
